images.summary: This foundation plan shows the layout for the foundation of a renovation project. Key elements include ICF wall assemblies labeled as 'ICF1', concrete piers marked 'P1' and 'P3', and a steel beam labeled 'W8x18'. The plan specifies a foundation area of 56'-0" by 28'-0" with floor joists and stairs as per the Ontario Building Code (OBC). The foundation supports an existing floor system and includes notes for removing existing rim joists for new joist bearing on existing foundations. Dimensions such as 28'-2" and 13'-0 1/2" indicate specific areas within the foundation layout.

The plan outlines the foundation layout with elements such as 'ICF1' for wall assemblies, 'P1' and 'P3' for concrete piers, and 'W8x18' for steel beams. images.text_verbatim:
LEGEND
SMOKE & C.O. DETECTOR
MAIN FLOOR PLAN NOTES
1. ALL FASTENERS IN TO TREATED WOOD SHALL BE ACQ RATED.
2. ALL INTERIOR WALLS ARE "IW1" UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.
3. ENSURE SOLID CONNECTION OF NEW EXT. WALLS TO EXISTING WALLS.
FLOOR ASSEMBLIES
FL2 MAIN FLOOR SYSTEM :
FINISH FLOOR ON UNDERLAY AS REQ'D.
3/4" T&G SHEATHING SCREWED & GLUED
FLOOR JOISTS PER PLAN
BRIDGING PER PLAN
FL3 P.T. DECK SYSTEM :
5/4 P.T. DECKING SCREWED TO
P.T. DECK JOISTS PER PLAN
WALL ASSEMBLIES
EW1 2x6 SIDING EXTERIOR WALL:
SIDING PER CLIENT
1" RIGID INSULATION (JOINTS TAPED)
7/16" OSB SHEATHING
2x6 STUDS @ 16" o.c.
R22 BATT INSULATION
S6 MIL POLY VAPOR BARRIER
1/2" DRYWALL TAPED & SANDED
EW2 EXISTING EXTERIOR WALL
COLUMN SCHEDULE
C1 6x6 P.T. No.2 OR BETTER POST c/w SIMPSON
ABU66Z POST BASE TO PIER AND FASTENED
TO BEAM ABOVE WITH BC66 BRACKET (OR
EQUIVALENT) (SEE DETAIL 1/D1)

BEAM SCHEDULE
B3 (2) 2x10 P.T. BUILT-UP BEAM
B4 (3) 2x10 P.T. BUILT-UP BEAM
images.summary: This section contains notes and schedules for the main floor plan. The notes emphasize the use of ACQ-rated fasteners for treated wood and the requirement for solid connections between new and existing exterior walls. Floor assemblies include 'FL2' for the main floor system with 3/4" T&G sheathing and 'FL3' for the P.T. deck system. Wall assemblies 'EW1' and 'EW2' detail the construction of exterior walls with components like 2x6 studs, R22 batt insulation, and 1/2" drywall. The column schedule lists 'C1' as a 6x6 P.T. post with Simpson hardware and 'C2' as a 3-ply 2x6 built-up post. The beam schedule includes 'B3' and 'B4' as built-up beams using 2x10 P.T. lumber.

images.summary: This plan view shows the main floor layout, focusing on the deck and covered deck areas. The dimensions provided are 13'-10 1/4", 81'-1 1/4", 20'-0", 27'-3", and 10'-0", indicating the spatial layout of the decks. The section callout 'A/A2' suggests a related section view. Element callouts include 'FL3', 'B3', 'B4', 'C1', 'EW1', and 'EW2', identifying specific structural components like beams and columns. The note '(3) PLY TRUSS GIRDER SEE ROOF PLAN' indicates a connection to the roof structure. The plan integrates with the existing manufactured home, ensuring structural continuity.

images.text_verbatim: ROOF PLAN NOTES 1. MAINTAIN 10" TRUSS HEEL FOR INSULATION AND ROOF VENTING. 2. PROVIDE VENTED SOFFITS AND 1 1/2" VENTING BETWEEN SHEATHING AND INSULATION (INSTALL ATTIC VENTS). 3. PROVIDE FOR 24" EAVE, 24" GABLE FINISHED OVERHANGS UNLESS NOTED OTHERWISE. 4. WALLS AND BEAMS SHOWN ARE BEARING. 5. PROVIDE ACCESS TO ATTIC FROM FLOOR BELOW. 6. PROVIDE PRE-ENGINEERED TRUSS DRAWINGS TO BUILDING DEPARTMENT PRIOR TO SITE INSPECTION. 7. VERIFY DIMENSIONS AND SUITABILITY BEFORE MANUFACTURE OF TRUSSES. 8. PROVIDE TRUSS LAYOUT TO DESIGNER PRIOR TO WALL FRAMING AND MANUFACTURE OF TRUSS. ROOF ASSEMBLIES ID NOTE R1 PRE ENGINEERED WOOD TRUSS ROOF: PRE FINISHED METAL WATERPROOFING MEMBRANE 1/2" ROOFING PLYWOOD c/w 'H' CLIPS (ALTERNATE: 5/8" T&G OSB SHEATHING) OR 1x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c. PRE-ENGINEERED TRUSSES 2x4 TRUSS BRACING AS REQ'D R2 PRE ENGINEERED WOOD TRUSS ROOF: PRE FINISHED METAL WATERPROOFING MEMBRANE 1/2" ROOFING PLYWOOD c/w 'H' CLIPS (ALTERNATE: 5/8" T&G OSB SHEATHING) OR 1x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c. PRE-ENGINEERED SCISSOR TRUSSES 2x4 TRUSS BRACING AS REQ'D R3 OVERLAY FRAMING c/w 2x8 VALLEY BOARDS 2x8 RIDGE BOARD & 2x6 RAFTERS @ 24" o.c. CEILING ASSEMBLIES ID NOTE CLG1 VAULTED CEILING ASSEMBLY: R32 BATT INSULATION S-6 mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER 1/2" DRYWALL TAPED AND SANDED. CLG2 PORCH CEILING ASSEMBLY: 1x4 STRAPPING @ 16" o/c VENTED ALUMINUM SOFFIT CLG3 FLAT CEILING ASSEMBLY: R50 INSULATION S-6 mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER 1/2" DRYWALL TAPED AND SANDED.
images.summary: This image contains roof plan notes and assemblies. Key notes include maintaining a 10" truss heel for insulation and venting, providing vented soffits, and ensuring 24" eave and gable overhangs. Roof assemblies are detailed with IDs R1, R2, and R3, describing pre-engineered wood truss roofs with metal waterproofing membranes and specific plywood or OSB sheathing options. Ceiling assemblies CLG1, CLG2, and CLG3 specify insulation, vapor barriers, and drywall finishes. These notes ensure the roof's structural integrity and compliance with design specifications.

Structural components such as the 'Structural Gable Truss', 'Pre-Engineered Trusses', and 'Pre-Eng. (3) Ply Girder Truss' are highlighted. Element callouts 'R1', 'R2', 'CLG2', and 'CLG3' identify specific truss and ceiling types. The plan ensures proper spacing and alignment of trusses and rafters, maintaining the roof's structural integrity.

images.text_verbatim:
ROOF ASSEMBLIES
ID NOTE
R1 PRE ENGINEERED WOOD TRUSS ROOF:
PRE FINISHED METAL
WATERPROOFING MEMBRANE
1/2" ROOFING PLYWOOD c/w 'H' CLIPS
(ALTERNATE: 5/8" T&G OSB SHEATHING)
OR 1x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
PRE-ENGINEERED TRUSSES
2x4 TRUSS BRACING AS REQ'D
R2 PRE ENGINEERED WOOD TRUSS ROOF:
PRE FINISHED METAL
WATERPROOFING MEMBRANE
1/2" ROOFING PLYWOOD c/w 'H' CLIPS
(ALTERNATE: 5/8" T&G OSB SHEATHING)
OR 1x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
PRE-ENGINEERED SCISSOR TRUSSES
2x4 TRUSS BRACING AS REQ'D
R3 OVERLAY FRAMING c/w 2x8 VALLEY BOARDS
2x8 RIDGE BOARD & 2x6 RAFTERS @ 24" o.c.
CEILING ASSEMBLIES
ID NOTE
CLG1 VAULTED CEILING ASSEMBLY:
R32 BATT INSULATION
S-6 mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
1/2" DRYWALL TAPED AND SANDED.
CLG2 PORCH CEILING ASSEMBLY:
1x4 STRAPPING @ 16" o/c
VENTED ALUMINUM SOFFIT
CLG3 FLAT CEILING ASSEMBLY:
R50 INSULATION
S-6 mil POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
1/2" DRYWALL TAPED AND SANDED
images.summary: This schedule outlines the roof and ceiling assemblies for the building. Roof assemblies include pre-engineered wood truss roofs with pre-finished metal and waterproofing membranes. R1 and R2 specify 1/2" roofing plywood with 'H' clips, with an alternate option of 5/8" T&G OSB sheathing or 1x4 strapping at 24" o.c. R1 uses pre-engineered trusses, while R2 uses scissor trusses. R3 involves overlay framing with 2x8 valley boards and 2x6 rafters at 24" o.c. Ceiling assemblies include CLG1, a vaulted ceiling with R32 batt insulation and a poly vapour barrier, CLG2, a porch ceiling with 1x4 strapping at 16" o.c. and vented aluminum soffit, and CLG3, a flat ceiling with R50 insulation and a poly vapour barrier. Each assembly is detailed with specific materials and construction methods.

images.summary: This section view illustrates a building cross-section, highlighting the roof and crawl space. The section includes pre-engineered girder trusses labeled as R4, R2, and R1. The ceiling levels are marked as CLG1 and CLG2. The section shows a vented soffit and existing roof structure above a screened deck. The crawl space is labeled as 'Existing Crawl Space'. Vertical dimensions are provided, such as the top of the roof at 7'-9 11/16", top of the wall at 8'-1 1/8", and top of foundation at 8'-0". The note 'Ensure min 4'-0" cover to conc. pier ftgs' specifies the required concrete cover for pier footings. This section is crucial for understanding the vertical relationships and structural components within the building.

images.text_verbatim:
1/D1 CONC. PIER DETAIL
SCALE 3/4" = 1'-0"
GUARDS PER OBC
COLUMNS FASTENED TO BEAM WITH SIMPSON BRACKET
NOTE: ALL FASTENERS INTO TREATED LUMBER SHALL BE ACQ RATED.
2 - 1/2" DIA. x 3 1/2" A307 LAG SCREWS (4 TOTAL)
GRADE
CONCRETE PIER ON FTG. PER PLAN
2 - 15M INTO FOOTING
PROVIDE 2" CONC. COVER TO ALL REINFORCING
FOOTING PER PLAN
COLUMN PER PLAN
SIMPSON BASE SADDLE C/W 2 - 1/2" x 4" HILTI KWIK ANCHORS INTO PIER (OR EQUIVALENT)
images.summary: This detail shows a concrete pier with specific construction instructions. The pier is anchored with a Simpson base saddle and Hilti Kwik anchors. Columns are fastened to the beam using a Simpson bracket, with all fasteners into treated lumber being ACQ rated. The detail specifies the use of 2 - 1/2" diameter x 3 1/2" A307 lag screws, totaling four. Reinforcement includes 2 - 15M bars into the footing, with a 2" concrete cover required for all reinforcing. The note 'Footing per plan' indicates that the footing details are specified elsewhere. This detail ensures the structural integrity of the pier and its compliance with design standards.

The detail specifies 'Deck per plan' and 'Screws per plan', indicating that the exact specifications for these elements are detailed elsewhere. The scale of the drawing is 3/4" = 1'-0", providing precise measurements for construction. This detail is essential for ensuring the proper installation and structural integrity of the deck ledger.
